oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Case report: Bovine ethylene glycol toxicosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fritz, Scott A.
Ensley, Steve M.
Njaa, Bradley L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine
nephrosis
ethylene glycol
toxicosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Acute death of 1-month-old calves on pasture that were accidentally exposed to an oil/antifreeze mix were investigated. Clinical signs were not observed and necropsy findings were non-specific. Histological diagnosis of calcium oxalate nephrosis with concurrent tubulointerstitial suppurative nephritis was supported by culture. Ethylene glycol exposure was confirmed via analytical methods.
